benchmark_details.name: EmbSpatial-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: EmbSpatial-Bench is a benchmark for evaluating embodied spatial understanding of Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs), constructed from 3D environments to assess their capabilities in interpreting spatial relationships from an egocentric perspective.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the embodied spatial understanding capabilities of LVLMs in a manner that reflects their application in real-life scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark and findings are limited to English language and may not be suitable for outdoor environments.

data.source: Constructed from three widely used indoor embodied datasets: Matterport3D, ScanNet, and AI2-THOR.
data.annotation: Automatically derived from annotated 3D environments and verified by humans.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of LVLMs in identifying spatial relationships.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in embodied spatial understanding.
methodology.baseline_results: Current LVLMs' best performance reached only up to 49.11% accuracy, while human performance was around 90.33%.
methodology.validation: Evaluation was conducted using zero-shot performance assessment.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The benchmark is built from publicly available datasets containing no personal data or offensive content.
